org.apache.ignite.hadoop.fs

Class CachingHadoopFileSystemFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ignite.hadoop.fs.BasicHadoopFileSystemFactory
      • org.apache.ignite.hadoop.fs.CachingHadoopFileSystemFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Externalizable, Serializable, HadoopFileSystemFactory

    public class CachingHadoopFileSystemFactory
extends BasicHadoopFileSystemFactory
    Caching Hadoop file system factory. Caches FileSystem instances on per-user basis. Doesn't rely on built-in Hadoop FileSystem caching mechanics. Separate FileSystem instance is created for each user instead.

    This makes cache instance resistant to concurrent calls to FileSystem.close() in other parts of the user code. On the other hand, this might cause problems on some environments. E.g. if Kerberos is enabled, a call to FileSystem.get(URI, Configuration, String) will refresh Kerberos token. But this factory implementation calls this method only once per user what may lead to token expiration. In such cases it makes sense to either use BasicHadoopFileSystemFactory or implement your own factory.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
